item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
The end of last week got weird between 1) Danika unexpectedly contracting norovirus and becoming extremely ill 2) My kids handing over their my first cold of the season and 3) Chia traveling back from an overseas trip. This week will end up swinging in the exact opposite direction, with way more streams and articles than usual. Blessed. Plus, I'm happy to report that after discovering some dirtbag teenagers knocked over my 12-foot skeleton as I was headed to bed this past Friday night, I was able to repair enough of Jackson Bones to get him back up. I don't think he'll survive another hit, though.

-pk, who was also somewhat of a dirtbag teenager during a notably regrettable stretch but it never veered into actual property damage

  • PODCAST: HOA – A new house means new neighbors, and new neighbors can mean new neighborhood drama. Rob chases down an off leash dog mystery that he wants nothing to do with, Patrick's roof woes come to a conclusion, and car troubles catch up with Rob.
  • STREAMS: Ball x Pit x Patrick – Join Patrick for some brief morning streams as he attempts to dismantle the world of Ball x Pit, one ball at a time!
  • ARTICLE: One of 2025's Best Games, And Roger, Is About God, Love, and Loss – A conversation with Yona, the designer behind And Roger, about why he decided to make a video game about making peace with saying goodbye.
  • STREAM: Steam Next Fest – This one got delayed, but we haven't forgotten!
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – Should be a full crew this week!
  • STREAM: Spookin' With Scoops – I'm going to try and sneak in a night stream. We'll see. It depends on the cold escaping my body later this week.
  • STREAM: Danika Tries Silksong – Danika isn't sure Silksong is for her, so as she dips her toes in, she'll be joined by Silksong experts Janet and Chia.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – This week, we're talking about trick or treating, both what you do as the person doing the candy shopping and handing it out.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
